title: 113_s2064
content: The "Four Rationers Repeal Act of 2014" repeals the Independent Payment Advisory Board and the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Innovation. This Act restores provisions of law as if the repealed sections had not been enacted. The "Four Rationers Repeal Act of 2014" repeals Section 1115A of the Social Security Act and makes conforming amendments to Title XVIII and Title XIX of the SSA, as well as Section 933 of the Public Health Service Act. The "Four Rationers Repeal Act of 2014" amends the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act by making changes to various sections, including section 2705 and section 10328(b). It involves striking certain subsections and inserting new language in others. The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date of enactment of this Act. SEC. 4 repeals certain authorities related to determining benefits under the Public Health Service Act and the Community Preventive Services Task Force. SEC. 5 prohibits certain uses of data from comparative effectiveness research and addresses personalized medicine and patient treatment response differences. The Secretary of Health and Human Services is prohibited from using data from comparative effectiveness research to deny coverage under Federal health care programs. Research must consider factors affecting patient treatment response and preferences. The curr_chunk discusses patient treatment preferences, genomics, personalized medicine, health disparity populations, and indirect patient benefits. It clarifies that the Commissioner of Food and Drugs' authority is not affected by this section.
